critique: The President wants to convey a sense of hope and confidence that the actions outlined in the order will lead to positive outcomes. The President also wants to convey a sense of urgency and importance regarding the need to address the issue of wildfires and forest management. The President wants to elicit joy that the communities and watersheds will be protected. The President wants to elicit sadness that the forests, rangelands, and other Federal lands have been weakened. The President wants to elicit fear that the communities and homes are at risk of damage from catastrophic wildfires. The President wants to elicit disgust that the dense trees and undergrowth have amassed in these lands, fueling catastrophic wildfires. The President wants to elicit surprise that the active management of vegetation is often delayed due to challenges associated with regulatory analysis and current consultation requirements.
